messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Representative Bogdanov, you're on deck.
Representative Domino is here to talk about emergency dispatchers, 911 dispatchers.
Welcome to the Health Care Council. You're recognized.
Thank you, Mr. Chairman and members. This bill upon passage will allow for a certification process for emergency dispatchers.
Currently, 31 other states have such a process. It will recognize a 208-hour DOE-approved course as a minimum standard.
The goal is to ensure that first responders are dispatched to emergencies and catastrophic events with a higher level of quality, efficiency, and minimized human errors.
Our emergency dispatchers do a great job, but having all 67 counties follow the same standards will be helpful.
We have some dramatic testimonies to support the need for this legislation.
Very good. Are there any questions for Representative Domino on the bill?
Let's go to public testimony. Representative Domino, do you want to call folks in a particular order?
No particular order.
Very good. Randy Touchton, you are up.
Thank you. Florida Professional Firefighters Association waves in support.
Armand Nalt, please come up.
Thank you. Firefighters and paramedics from Palm Beach County support this bill.
Gary Rainey, you're next.
Thank you. From Miami, Florida, representing the Florida professional firefighters.
Lisa Henning, please come forwards.
I am with the Fraternal Order of Police here in Tallahassee, and I support this bill.
Richard Goff, you're next.
Good morning. My name is Richard Goff, a 25-year law enforcement veteran and father of Denise Lee.
My daughter was kidnapped, raped, and murdered. The culprit drove her around, and she managed to get the attention of a bystander who called 911.
The bystander gave a description of the car and the suspect, but our dispatch failed to relay this information to the road deputies.
We had over six agencies, two helicopters, and approximately 30 people looking for her. She was found later buried in a shallow grave.
The internal investigation found fault with two dispatchers, but the consequences were minor. I urge you to pass this bill.
Thank you, Mr. Goff. Our hearts go out to you and your family. Amy Campbell, you're next.
I am from Orlando, Florida, representing the Orange County Sheriff's Office, and I wave in support.
Richard Pinsky, please come forwards.
I am from West Palm Beach and represent 911 emergency dispatchers. I support this bill.
Is there anyone else wishing to testify on House Bill 997?
We'll now move into debate. Representative Hayes, you are recognized.
Thank you, Mr. Chairman. I am deeply disturbed that this is only voluntary certification. We should look into making this mandatory in the future.
We need our 911 operators to be properly trained and certified. I support this bill, but it should go further.
Representative Harrell, you are recognized.
Thank you. My heart goes out to the Goff family. The importance of training for dispatchers in both health care and law enforcement cannot be overstated.
Often, 911 calls are health-related, and those dispatchers need appropriate training. This should be the standard across the state and be required.
Representative Hudson, you are recognized.
Thank you, Chairman. As a parent, I am speechless at Mr. Goff's testimony. Consistency in process is crucial across all counties to ensure quality information is disseminated efficiently.
Our first responders deserve the best support. I support this bill.
Representative Anderson, you are recognized.
Thank you, Mr. Chairman. I compliment Representative Domino for bringing this important bill forward. Communication and proper training are essential.
I agree that this certification should eventually be mandatory.
Representative Domino, would you like to close?
Thank you. As mentioned, 28 states have mandatory certification, and some have voluntary. We have to start somewhere.
This bill will save lives and significantly help in emergency situations. I urge your support.
Thank you, Representative Domino. The clerk will now call the roll on House Bill 997.
House Bill 997 will be reported favorably as a council substitute. Thank you, members.
